trans-unit.source: Upgrade to SQL Database V12
trans-unit.target: Upgrade to SQL Database V12

trans-unit.source: Explains how to upgrade to Azure SQL Database V12, from an earlier version of Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to upgrade to Azure SQL Database V12, from an earlier version of Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Upgrade to SQL Database V12 in place
trans-unit.target: Upgrade to SQL Database V12 in place

trans-unit.source: [Sign up](https://portal.azure.com) for SQL Database V12 to take advantage of the next generation of SQL Database on Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: [Sign up](https://portal.azure.com) for SQL Database V12 to take advantage of the next generation of SQL Database on Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: First, you need a subscription to Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: First, you need a subscription to Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Sign up for a [free Azure trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial) and review [pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/sql-database) information.
trans-unit.target: Sign up for a [free Azure trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial) and review [pricing](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/sql-database) information.

trans-unit.source: Steps to upgrade to SQL Database V12
trans-unit.target: Steps to upgrade to SQL Database V12

trans-unit.source: Upgrade step
trans-unit.target: Upgrade step

trans-unit.source: Screen shot
trans-unit.target: Screen shot

trans-unit.source: 1. Sign in to [http://portal.azure.com/](http://portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: 1. Sign in to [http://portal.azure.com/](http://portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: ![New Azure Portal][1]
trans-unit.target: ![New Azure Portal][1]

trans-unit.source: 2. Click **BROWSE**.
trans-unit.target: 2. Click **BROWSE**.

trans-unit.source: ![Browse Services][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Browse Services][2]

trans-unit.source: 3. Click **SQL servers**.
trans-unit.target: 3. Click **SQL servers**.

trans-unit.source: A list of SQL Server names is displayed.
trans-unit.target: A list of SQL Server names is displayed.

trans-unit.source: ![Select SQL Server service][3]
trans-unit.target: ![Select SQL Server service][3]

trans-unit.source: 4. Select the server you want to copy to a new server with SQL Database Update enabled.
trans-unit.target: 4. Select the server you want to copy to a new server with SQL Database Update enabled.

trans-unit.source: ![Shows a list of SQL Servers][4]
trans-unit.target: ![Shows a list of SQL Servers][4]

trans-unit.source: 5. Click **Settings** or **Server version** to upgrade your server to V12.
trans-unit.target: 5. Click **Settings** or **Server version** to upgrade your server to V12.

trans-unit.source: ![Latest preview feature][5]
trans-unit.target: ![Latest preview feature][5]

trans-unit.source: 6. Click **UPGRADE THIS SERVER**.
trans-unit.target: 6. Click **UPGRADE THIS SERVER**.

trans-unit.source: ![Upgrades the SQL Server to the preview][6]
trans-unit.target: ![Upgrades the SQL Server to the preview][6]

trans-unit.source: 7. Once you click **UPGRADE THIS SERVER**, the upgrade process will be initiated.
trans-unit.target: 7. Once you click **UPGRADE THIS SERVER**, the upgrade process will be initiated.

trans-unit.source: Under **Server version**, the notification changes from **V2** to **Upgrade scheduled..**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Server version**, the notification changes from **V2** to **Upgrade scheduled..**.

trans-unit.source: If you click on the **Upgrade scheduled..** notification, a blade opens with the **Cancel Upgrade** button at the top.
trans-unit.target: If you click on the **Upgrade scheduled..** notification, a blade opens with the **Cancel Upgrade** button at the top.

trans-unit.source: Click **Cancel Upgrade** in case you decide against upgrading the server for any reason.
trans-unit.target: Click **Cancel Upgrade** in case you decide against upgrading the server for any reason.

trans-unit.source: Please **note** that cancel operation will not work towards the end of the upgrade process and the upgrade will be completed.
trans-unit.target: Please **note** that cancel operation will not work towards the end of the upgrade process and the upgrade will be completed.

trans-unit.source: ![Cancel Upgrade][9]
trans-unit.target: ![Cancel Upgrade][9]

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Once you select the upgrade option, your server and the databases within that server will be enabled with SQL Database V12 features, and you will not be able to reverse that.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Once you select the upgrade option, your server and the databases within that server will be enabled with SQL Database V12 features, and you will not be able to reverse that.

trans-unit.source: To upgrade servers to SQL Database V12, you require a Basic, Standard or Premium service tier.
trans-unit.target: To upgrade servers to SQL Database V12, you require a Basic, Standard or Premium service tier.

trans-unit.source: For more information on the service tiers,see [Upgrade SQL Database Web/Business Databases to New Service Tiers"](sql-database-upgrade-new-service-tiers.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on the service tiers,see [Upgrade SQL Database Web/Business Databases to New Service Tiers"](sql-database-upgrade-new-service-tiers.md).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Geo-replication is not supported with SQL Database V12 (preview).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Geo-replication is not supported with SQL Database V12 (preview).

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Plan and Prepare to Upgrade to Azure SQL Database V12 Preview](sql-database-v12-plan-prepare-upgrade.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Plan and Prepare to Upgrade to Azure SQL Database V12 Preview](sql-database-v12-plan-prepare-upgrade.md).

trans-unit.source: Once you click the **UPGRADE THIS SERVER** option, the blade that opens shows a message about a validation process.
trans-unit.target: Once you click the **UPGRADE THIS SERVER** option, the blade that opens shows a message about a validation process.

trans-unit.source: The validation process checks the service tier of your database and checks whether Geo-replication is enabled.
trans-unit.target: The validation process checks the service tier of your database and checks whether Geo-replication is enabled.

trans-unit.source: The blade will show the results after the validation is complete.
trans-unit.target: The blade will show the results after the validation is complete.

trans-unit.source: After the validation process is complete, you will see a list of database names that require you to take action to meet the requirements of upgrading to SQL Database V12.
trans-unit.target: After the validation process is complete, you will see a list of database names that require you to take action to meet the requirements of upgrading to SQL Database V12.

trans-unit.source: **You need to complete the actions for each of those databases to be able to upgrade to SQL Database V12**.
trans-unit.target: **You need to complete the actions for each of those databases to be able to upgrade to SQL Database V12**.

trans-unit.source: As you click on each database name, a new blade provides service pricing tier recommendation based on your current usage.
trans-unit.target: As you click on each database name, a new blade provides service pricing tier recommendation based on your current usage.

trans-unit.source: You can also browse various pricing tiers and select the one that suits your environment best.
trans-unit.target: You can also browse various pricing tiers and select the one that suits your environment best.

trans-unit.source: All the databases that are setup for Geo Replication need to be reconfigured to stop replication.
trans-unit.target: All the databases that are setup for Geo Replication need to be reconfigured to stop replication.

trans-unit.source: Note that a recommendation on pricing tier will not be displayed if enough data is not found.
trans-unit.target: Note that a recommendation on pricing tier will not be displayed if enough data is not found.

trans-unit.source: Action
trans-unit.target: Action

trans-unit.source: Screen shot
trans-unit.target: Screen shot

trans-unit.source: 7. Once you have completed the actions that prepares your server for the upgrade, type the name of the server to upgrade and Click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: 7. Once you have completed the actions that prepares your server for the upgrade, type the name of the server to upgrade and Click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: ![Confirm the server name to upgrade][7]
trans-unit.target: ![Confirm the server name to upgrade][7]

trans-unit.source: 8. The upgrade process is initiated.
trans-unit.target: 8. The upgrade process is initiated.

trans-unit.source: Upgrade can take up to 24 hours.
trans-unit.target: Upgrade can take up to 24 hours.

trans-unit.source: During this time all databases on this server will remain online but server and database management actions will be restricted.
trans-unit.target: During this time all databases on this server will remain online but server and database management actions will be restricted.

trans-unit.source: Once the process is complete, the status **Enabled** is displayed on the server blade.
trans-unit.target: Once the process is complete, the status **Enabled** is displayed on the server blade.

trans-unit.source: ![Confirms preview features are enabled][8]
trans-unit.target: ![Confirms preview features are enabled][8]

trans-unit.source: Powershell cmdlets
trans-unit.target: Powershell cmdlets

trans-unit.source: Powershell cmdlets are available to start, stop, or monitor an upgrade to Azure SQL Database V12 from V11 or any other pre-V12 version.
trans-unit.target: Powershell cmdlets are available to start, stop, or monitor an upgrade to Azure SQL Database V12 from V11 or any other pre-V12 version.

trans-unit.source: For reference documentation about these Powershell cmdlets, see:
trans-unit.target: For reference documentation about these Powershell cmdlets, see:

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureSqlServerUpgrade
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureSqlServerUpgrade

trans-unit.source: Start-AzureSqlServerUpgrade
trans-unit.target: Start-AzureSqlServerUpgrade

trans-unit.source: Stop-AzureSqlServerUpgrade
trans-unit.target: Stop-AzureSqlServerUpgrade

trans-unit.source: The Stop- cmdlet means cancel, not pause.
trans-unit.target: The Stop- cmdlet means cancel, not pause.

trans-unit.source: There is no way to resume an upgrade, other than starting again from the beginning.
trans-unit.target: There is no way to resume an upgrade, other than starting again from the beginning.

trans-unit.source: The Stop- cmdlet cleans up and releases all appropriate resources.
trans-unit.target: The Stop- cmdlet cleans up and releases all appropriate resources.

trans-unit.source: Related Links
trans-unit.target: Related Links

trans-unit.target: What's new in SQL Database V12

trans-unit.target: Plan and prepare to upgrade to SQL Database V12
